content.description: Overhung feet to a wide spot necessitate a lieback on thin edge is the crux.  Not too hard, the rock is good and then the finish is typical Sedona.  This is Jake having fun.
content.protection: small to large pro, up to #3 or 4 camalot.  Rap from chains single 60m.
content.location: Approach from Soldier Pass trailhead, as for Crimson Crescent but head for the drainage below the Tower, it's just south of Cíbola Mitten and the route climbs the shady notch between the two.

content.description: chimney and hand crack through a bulge to the gully between the tower and it's northern sub-tower, then mantle past a bolt to bolted anchor.
content.location: climbs the west/northwest face of the tower northeast of "Cíbola Mitten aka The Sphinx"

climbs.name: MAJAKOL Line
climbs.fa: Manny Rangel and Jake Dayley and Kole Decou

content.description: The start is face to a thin crack that widens to perfect hands, the rock is harder than lots of other soft sedona routes.  Great hands for a long ways then a short easy OW section gets you to the works.  A 10' roof guards the exit but it's no more than 10+ jams with a bomber lock after the roof.  Steep lieback on the limestone band to exit right and you're done.
content.protection: one bolt, (2) black aliens, (1)blue, red camalot, (5) #2 camalots, (2) #3 camalot, sm to med nuts (hexes optional, I like em).  Anchor at start and rap off chains with 70m or double ropes.
content.location: From Soldier Pass trailhead walk easterly on trail to drainage wandering north to the base of Tower of Bootle and Cíbola Mitten. Get into the drainage south of the Tower and approach from the west on ledges to just south of tower. Climb starts on east face with anchor bolts.

climbs.name: Kamikaze Corner
climbs.fa: T. Coats, P. Davidson, D. Dawson

content.description: Wide fingers to small roof in dihedral p1; wandering face on slab (no real pro) to chimney.
content.protection: Fingers to #4 camalot or big bro for exit chimney.  Slung huge loose block for anchor on p1, not much pro on p2 for a spicy runout lead that I thought I wouldn't be able to back off once committed. Wander to top and walk SE to anchors on Crimson Crescent, rap double ropes.
content.location: NE corner of Cíbola Mitten, wander up from east side to base of route in notch.

content.description: Varied route up South face. P1: 5.9+ corner; P2: 5.11- exciting face climbing past 10 bolts. P3: 5.9 varied cracks & 3 bolts to anchors below crescent. P4: 5.10+  up and under crescent (many bolts, some gear) to summit slabs. rap the route w/ one 70m or multiple ropes.
content.protection: Stoppers, 10 QDs, single set of cams to #4 Camalot.

content.description: Starts as a tricky bolted face then thru roofs to overhung tight hands in an overhung dihedral. The rock is very clean and solid for most of the way, except the very end, go left to face for a ways then onto the limestone band.
content.protection: 6 bolts, nuts, double purple to yellow camalots, #4 camalot.
content.location: Make your way up the drainage just south of the tower to the west, wander to the southeast end of tower and find the first 6 bolts below a striking dihedral 50' above.  First clip is easy and serves as the anchor as well.

content.description: The initial crux is after the second bolt it's a strange stem, hand foot match to top out on a slopey ledge.  Above is a wide fists crack that overhangs a tad that may be the real crux.  Easy rock to top.
content.protection: Two bolts to start then small to wide (#4 camalot, 3.5 useful)
content.location: Look for the small tower south of Cíbola Mitten and north of Morning Glory Spire. This is a sunny route on the SW face; approach from the west on ledges.

content.description: P1: 5.10  TRAVERSE!!! about 100ft past gear placements and bolts to a nice ledge.    P2: 5.10+  CRACK!!! clip a bolt and head up steep finger and hand crack, passing another bolt then up to a ledge atop the column.   P3: 5.10,C1  STEEP!!! 4th class up slab to ledge then climb face on huecos, clip bolt, then thin fingers(aid)and edges past bulge to summit. (will probably go free at 5.12)
content.protection: doubles from tiny to #3 camalot & 1 #3.5 useful.   small nuts very useful.   Descent: rap twice North side to Kamikazi Corner w/ 60M rope- anchors are bonified!
content.location: start from the notch between Cíbola Mitten and Sweetheart Spire. Approach from Jordan Road TH about 10min then up climbers trail/wash and slick rock toward the saddle north of Sweetheart Spire.

content.description: 400ft dome w/ east and west mini towers.
